DESCRIPTION #



Amphetamine Images


                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears between the "Online Books Vault" section (listing resources like PiHKAL, TiHKAL, and E for Ecstasy) and the start of the "Amphetamine Basics" content in the Chemicals section, connecting Erowid's library resources to detailed information about amphetamines.

metadata.title: Erowid Amphetamines Vault: Basics
metadata.description: A summary of basic information about Amphetamines and its use.

content:
Drug: Amphetamine | cid: 3007
Source: erowid | Source description: A summary of basic information about Amphetamines and its use.
Erowid name: amphetamines
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Basics

                    Text: 
                    Amphetamine

Basics

by Erowid

DESCRIPTION #



Amphetamine Images

Amphetamines include both the specific chemical 'amphetamine' and the general class of chemicals which share structural similaries. Amphetamines generally cause strong physical and mental stimulation, keeping users awake and alert for many hours, and some amphetamines cause mood lift / euphoria. Because they increase wakefulness, various amphetamines have been used by the military, by pilots, truck drivers, and other workers to keep functioning past their normal limits. Amphetamines are also used to treat Attention Deficit Disorder and can have the seemingly paradoxical effect of quieting and calming users. Common amphetamines include Dexedrine (d-amphetamine), methamphetamine, and adderall (dl-amphetamine). Substantial amounts of pharmaceutical amphetamines are diverted from medical use to recreational and work-related uses and methamphetamine is produced in huge quantities in underground labs around the world.


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is from the "Amphetamine Basics" section of Erowid's comprehensive index on psychoactive substances, specifically within the Chemicals > Amphetamines vault. It provides an overview of amphetamines, describing their stimulant effects, common uses, and examples of popular compounds like Dexedrine, methamphetamine, and Adderall. The content serves as a general introduction to amphetamines, situating them within broader information on chemistry, history, effects, law, and related substances available elsewhere in the document.

content:
Drug: Amphetamine | cid: 3007
Source: erowid | Source description: A summary of basic information about Amphetamines and its use.
Erowid name: amphetamines
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Basics

                    Text: 
                    [ Main Amphetamine Vault ]

Dose #

Dose Summary Needed.

Price #

2023: Methamphetamine is sold for $20-200 USD retail per gram for good quality crystals and $10-100 USD for wholesale or 'family' prices. Lower quality meth is sold for $10-50 per gram. Dexedrine is sold for .75 - 2$ per 10 mg dose by prescription and $2-15 per pill on the underground market.

Law #

Amphetamines and methamphetamine are Schedule 2 in the United States and their possession requires a valid prescription. Most countries control amphetamines tightly as medicines.

Chemistry #

Chemistry Summary Needed.

Pharmacology #

Pharmacology Summary Needed.

Production #

Production Summary Needed.

History #


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides key factual summaries about amphetamines, including typical dosages, street and prescription pricing, legal status, and brief entries for chemistry, pharmacology, production, and history. It serves as part of Erowid's "Amphetamine Basics" section, aimed at offering concise, reference-style information for users seeking an overview of amphetamine characteristics, market details, regulation, and background, within the broader chemicals reference index.

metadata.title: Erowid Amphetamines Vault: Basics
metadata.description: A summary of basic information about Amphetamines and its use.

content:
Drug: Amphetamine | cid: 3007
Source: erowid | Source description: A summary of basic information about Amphetamines and its use.
Erowid name: amphetamines
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Basics

                    Text: 
                    Chemistry #

Chemistry Summary Needed.

Pharmacology #

Pharmacology Summary Needed.

Production #

Production Summary Needed.

History #

Amphetamine was first synthesized by German chemist L. Edeleano in 1887 (originally named phenylisopropylamine). In the 1930's amphetamines were first marketed as 'benzedrine' in an over-the-counter inhaler to treat congestion and in the late 30's, amphetamine was prescribed for the treatment of narcolepsy and ADHD (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder). Amphetamine use grew rapidly when amphetamines were distributed to soldiers during World War II. In 1971, amphetamines were scheduled in the United States and prescriptions became required for possession.

Terminology / Slang #

The Substance:

Amphetamine; Speed; Dex; Adderall; Dexamphetamine; Bennies; Dexies; Black Beauty; Jollies.

The Experience:

Speeding; Tweaking; Spinning; Up.

EFFECTS #

Effects Summary Needed.

Onset #

Onset Summary Needed.

Duration #


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is part of Erowid's "Amphetamine Basics" page, following sections on legal status, chemistry, and pricing. It covers brief historical background on amphetamine, common slang and terminology, and introduces various effect-related subsections, each marked as needing further summary.

Field: Basics

                    Text: 
                    The Experience:

Speeding; Tweaking; Spinning; Up.

EFFECTS #

Effects Summary Needed.

Onset #

Onset Summary Needed.

Duration #

Oral amphetamine tablets take 30 - 60 minutes to take effect on an empty stomach. Effects last around 4 to 6 hours for rapid release and 8 to 12 hours for extended release formulations.

Visual Effects #

Visuals Summary Needed.

PROBLEMS #

Problems Summary Needed.

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid Basics pages are summaries of data gathered from site visitors, government documents, books, websites, and other resources. We do our best to keep this information correct and up-to-date, but the field is complex and constantly changing. Information should always be verified through multiple sources.


                    Context: 
                    This section provides an overview of the subjective experiences, onset, duration, and potential problems and health risks associated with amphetamine use, as part of Erowidâ€™s comprehensive summary on the basics, effects, and safety considerations of amphetamines.
